content.prompt: Identical containers X and Y each contain a sample of the same monatomic ideal gas. The two samples have the same temperature but the pressure of the gas in Container X is greater than the pressure of the gas in Container Y. A student claims that Container X must contain more gas atoms than Container Y. Which of the following correctly indicates whether the claim is correct or incorrect, and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: Correct, because the average speed of the gas atoms is the same in both gases and therefore the number of collisions per second of the atoms with the container walls must be greater in Container X.
Correct, because having more gas atoms means that the average speed of the atoms will be greater and each atom in Container X will on average exert a greater force on the container walls.
Incorrect, because the gases in both containers are at the same temperature and therefore must have the same number of gas atoms.
Incorrect, because the pressure of the gas in Container X is greater and therefore will have fewer collisions per second with the container walls.

topic.text: 9.1: Kinetic Theory of Temperature and Pressure

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
